intro: [WRONG START] Hieracussion palantianum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow with a central disc. Hieracium palantianum is known for its ability to spread rapidly through rhizomes, making it an aggressive weed in some regions.
